repnme.cdata!:
Republic of Yemen - Second Health
            Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Second Health Development Project in
            Yemen. The principal objectives of the project were to
            improve the health status and quality of health services.
            Specifically, the project was designed to: (i) support the
            upgrading and extension of primary health care (PHC) in the
            governorates of Shabwa, Al Mahra and the island districts of
            Socrota and Perim; (ii) develop and upgrade health manpower
            in these areas; (iii) promote family planning and health
            education throughout the country; and (iv) strengthen the
            management capabilities of Ministry of Public Health (MOPH)
            staff and support decentralization of MOPH's
            administration. Bank's performance was satisfactory.
            Borrower's performance was satisfactory. The key
            lessons learned were as follows: (i) the current fiscal
            constraints and lack of resources allocated to lower level
            health services limit the government's ability to
            support the provision of PHC services where alternative
            cost-effective strategies are needed; (ii) there is a
            minimum package of inputs required for the effective
            delivery of health services which must be operational for
            implementation of health programs to be successful; (iii)
            women are more likely to seek care if a female health worker
            is available so their participation as health providers
            should be encouraged; (iv) appropriate incentive systems is
            critical for sustainability; (v) community participation can
            also support sustainability and should be encouraged; (vi)
            training programs should be located near the community to
            encourage the participation of women; (vii) including a
            specific mechanism for follow-up with other donors will
            facilitate monitoring the achievement of objectives; and
            (viii) delays in implementation hamper the achievement of
            project objectives. Similarly, revised output indicators
            should be formulated if there are significant implementation delays.

18150225.admreg: Middle East and North Africa,Middle East and North Africa

repnme.cdata!:
People's Democratic Republic of Yemen
            - Second Health Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Health Development Project
            constitutes a continuation of involvement in the health
            sector within the framework of the national health
            development plan, and will focus on the remaining
            underserved areas of the country. The project will finance :
            (i) the upgrading/reconstruction of 26 existing health care
            units; and (ii) the construction of 19 new health care
            units, 3 medical stores, a regional nursing school with
            dormitories, and 2 regional health directorates. The project
            will also provide for the provision of drugs, medical
            supplies, health education materials, furniture and
            equipment, and vehicles. Training, overseas fellowships, and
            consultant services are also included in the project.

People's Democratic Republic of Yemen -
